Title: La La Land (2016)
Director: Damien Chazelle
Starring: Ryan Gosling, Emma Stone, John Legend

Review:

From the moment the opening number bursts onto the screen, it's apparent that Damien Chazelle's "La La Land" is a love letter to the golden age of Hollywood musicals, infused with a modern touch and a passionate vision. Chazelle weaves a bittersweet tale of ambition, love, and chasing dreams through the swooning, vibrant lens of an enchanting musical.

"La La Land" revolves around the lives of two aspiring artists in Los Angeles: aspiring actress Mia Dolan (Emma Stone) and passionate jazz pianist Sebastian Wilder (Ryan Gosling). In a city known for crushing dreams, Mia and Sebastian find solace in each other as they work to achieve their own. Their chemistry is palpable as they sing, dance, and emote their way through a tumultuous journey of love and life.

The dazzling visuals and intricate choreography throughout the film is nothing short of breathtaking. Mandy Moore's inventive choreography fills each musical number with lively energy and boundless charm. Linus Sandgren's cinematography captures the beauty of Los Angeles while infusing it with an enchanting, dreamlike quality through the use of vibrant colors and stunning backdrops. From the Griffith Observatory to the Santa Monica pier, each location serves as a character in its own right.

Emma Stone delivers an outstanding performance as Mia, the hopeful actress. Stone effortlessly embodies Mia's vulnerability, determination, and wit as she encounters the various tribulations of her journey. Ryan Gosling also shines as the passionate Sebastian, fiercely dedicated to preserving the authenticity of jazz within an industry that is evolving to more modern styles. Gosling's piano performances alone are mesmerizing – a talent he developed specifically for this role. Together, Stone and Gosling light up the screen with a chemistry that feels both fresh and reminiscent of classic Hollywood pairings.

Justin Hurwitz's original score is a glorious triumph, combining elements of jazz and classic musical styles and weaving them into a symphony that guides the audience through the harmonious and discordant notes of Mia and Sebastian's story. Each song - from the infectious "Another Day of Sun" to the melancholic "City of Stars" – resonates on a deep emotional level, emphasizing the film's major themes with grace and poignancy.

While paying homage to the era of Hollywood musicals, Chazelle manages not to shy away from the harsh realities of life. The screenplay paints a picture of a bittersweet love story, daring to explore the balance between personal ambitions and relationships. Viewers are left with the question of sacrifice - what are we willing to forsake for our dreams? The film also grapples with the difficulties of pursuing non-conventional careers, a topic that resonates with many viewers in today's climate.

In conclusion, "La La Land" is a spellbinding cinematic experience that captures the essence of old Hollywood musicals while incorporating a modern sensibility. Thanks to Damien Chazelle's passionate direction, enchanting performances from Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling, and a poignant, heart-wrenching story, the film is an artistic triumph and a must-watch for any lover of music, film, and the pursuit of dreams.

Roberta Adams skipped the thick how-to guide on child-custody forms and sat down at a computer at the Lamoreaux Justice Center in Orange on Wednesday. The Garden Grove woman answered a series of questions to create and print a form to file with the court. "It's easy," said Adams, 25. "I thought I'd have all kinds of questions and have to take the forms home." A University of California, Irvine, study released Wednesday found an interactive computer system effectively helps people fill out paperwork for restraining orders, eviction defense, small-claims cases and requests for filing-fee waivers. Not only does the system make life easier for people who can't afford a lawyer, but it also might improve efficiency in the courts because the forms, which are printed out when completed, are easy to read and are being filled out correctly, the study found. Since the program started in 2000, more than 6,000 people have used the free system, located in public buildings throughout Orange County. The system was developed by the Legal Aid Society of Orange County with about $800,000 in grants. The program avoids legal jargon, offers a courthouse video tour and sticks to a fifth-grade vocabulary. Users can choose English, Spanish or Vietnamese. Kiosks are in courthouses in Fullerton and Orange, the district attorney's family-support office, the Legal Aid Society in Santa Ana, Irvine City Hall and the San Juan Capistrano Library. The program is also available online. Bob Cohen, executive director of Legal Aid, said the study should clear the way for expansion throughout California. Locally, a program for divorce petitions will be added this summer. Cohen said the system proves the benefit of technology tailored to those who aren't computer-savvy. He said much of the technology now available requires Internet skills and access. Low-income people, however, have less access to computers and less experience using them. "Our clients have to catch up, and they have to become a part of the mainstream," Cohen said. 

Question: "What education and language needs are met?"

Response: "A fifth grade vocabulary is used, and three languages are available: English, Vietnamese, and Spanish"

prompt:
Overkill is an American thrash metal band, formed in 1980 in New Jersey. They have gone through many line-up changes, leaving bassist D. D. Verni and lead vocalist Bobby "Blitz" Ellsworth as the only constant members. In addition to Verni and Ellsworth, Overkill's current lineup includes Dave Linsk on lead guitar, Derek Tailer on rhythm guitar and Jason Bittner on drums.

After taking a break, Overkill resurfaced in 2002 with Wrecking Everything, their second full-length live album, recorded at the Paramount Theatre in Asbury Park, New Jersey. The album contained only songs that had not been on Wrecking Your Neck, some simply because they were released on later albums, but also a few early songs from albums such as Taking Over and Under the Influence. The same show was used for Overkill's first ever DVD, Wrecking Everything - An Evening in Asbury Park, also released in 2002.  The European tour in June 2002, supporting both Bloodletting and Wrecking Everything saw Blaze and Wicked Mystic opening up for Overkill. During the second to last show of the tour in Nuremberg, Germany, Blitz suffered a stroke on stage and collapsed. For nearly three days, rumors ran rampant, reporting everything from Blitz being in a coma, permanently paralyzed, or even that Blitz had died. Finally, three days later, the band announced that the stroke was very minor and had no lasting consequences, as well as no cause that could be determined by the doctors.  Overkill signed to Spitfire Records and entered the studio in late 2002 to record their next studio album, Killbox 13. Produced by the band and Colin Richardson and released in March 2003, the album was actually only their twelfth regular studio album, but the Overkill EP was also counted to achieve the number 13. The album received critical acclaim, combining the "new" Overkill with their raw early style as presented on the debut album Feel the Fire. Touring for the album included a number of European festivals during the summer, and a full European tour followed in November with Seven Witches and After All. The band played without Derek Tailer, who was absent for undisclosed reasons. Nobody was hired to fill in for him, so Overkill toured as a four-piece for the first time since 1990. Tailer was still considered a full member of the band.  In late 2004, after a Japanese tour with Death Angel and Flotsam and Jetsam, the band started work on another record in D. D. Verni's own recording studio. The album, ReliXIV, was produced and mixed by the band themselves and released in March 2005.  Overkill toured the eastern US in April 2005, and just before they went on a European tour in May, it was announced that Tim Mallare would not take part in this tour. Replacing him for the tour was former Hades drummer Ron Lipnicki. A few weeks later, the band announced that Mallare had left permanently and Lipnicki was his replacement. In the summer of 2005, Overkill organized their first US west coast tour in more than ten years, playing Western Canada to Southern California. The tour was such a success that the band was added to the 2006 Gigantour bill, as second stage headliners, marking Overkill's first nationwide US tour since 1994.Answer this question using a quote from the following article:

Did they go on any tours during the era?

chosen:
"We cannot have a proper democracy without having a free, strong, and vibrant opposition."

In a democratic system of governance, an effective, robust opposition plays an integral role in maintaining a balanced, transparent and accountable government. The opposition speaks for the interests of all groups in society and voices the concerns of the people. A free, strong, and vibrant opposition can safeguard democracy in various ways:

1. Providing constructive criticism: A healthy opposition constructively criticizes the government's policies, highlighting their shortcomings and suggesting possible improvements. This ensures that the government remains responsive to the needs of the people and adopts better policies.

2. Impeding abuses of power: Democracy involves the separation of powers to prevent any one body from monopolizing authority. A robust opposition serves as a check and balance on the government by holding it accountable for its actions, thereby impeding potential abuses of power.

3. Encouraging debate and dialogue: Opposition parties create a space for diverse opinions and perspectives, fostering open dialogue and debate on various issues. This encourages the government to consider different viewpoints and defend its stance, leading to more informed decision-making processes.

4. Ensuring representation: In a democracy, different sectors of society should be well-represented to ensure that their needs and concerns are addressed. Strong opposition parties offer an alternative to the ruling party and represent the interests of those who may not support the government's policies.

5. Contributing to policy-making: Opposition parties contribute to policy-making by proposing alternative solutions to the issues faced by society. In some instances, they may collaborate with the government to put forward bipartisan legislation that benefits the nation as a whole.

6. Safeguarding democratic values: A free, strong, and vibrant opposition actively promotes and defends democratic institutions, values, and processes. By doing so, they play a crucial role in maintaining a well-functioning democratic system.

In conclusion, the presence of a free, strong, and vibrant opposition is essential for a proper democracy to thrive. It ensures that diverse perspectives are heard, abuses of power are prevented, and policy-making processes are more thorough, better representing the needs and concerns of the entire population.
rejected:
"It is impossible to have a truly democratic system without a strong, vibrant, and free opposition."

This statement highlights the crucial role that opposition plays in ensuring the health and vitality of a democratic system. Without a robust and diverse opposition, a democracy cannot function effectively, as it would lack the necessary checks and balances to prevent the abuse of power and ensure accountability.

A strong opposition serves several important purposes in a democratic system:

1. Provides a counterbalance to the ruling party: An opposition party or coalition of parties can offer an alternative vision and policy platform to the ruling party, providing a balance to the political landscape and preventing the concentration of power.
2. Acts as a watchdog over the ruling party: The opposition can scrutinize the actions of the ruling party, investigate allegations of wrongdoing, and hold them accountable for their actions.
3. Gives voice to diverse perspectives: A vibrant opposition can represent the interests of different groups and communities within society, ensuring that a wide range of views are represented in the political process.
4. Encourages political participation: A strong opposition can inspire citizens to become involved in politics, either by joining a political party or by participating in civil society organizations.
5. Promotes democratic values: An opposition that is committed to democratic principles can help to promote the values of democracy, such as transparency, accountability, and the rule of law.

In contrast, a democratic system without a strong opposition can lead to a number of negative consequences, including:

1. Abuse of power: Without a strong opposition to check their actions, the ruling party may become more authoritarian and abuse their power.
2. Lack of accountability: Without a strong opposition to hold them accountable, the ruling party may be less likely to be transparent and accountable for their actions.
3. Limited political participation: Without a strong opposition, citizens may become disillusioned with the political process and choose not to participate.
4. Decline of democratic institutions: A lack of opposition can lead to the decline of democratic institutions, such as parliamentary committees and the judiciary, which are essential for ensuring the rule of law and protecting human rights.

In conclusion, a strong and vibrant opposition is essential for ensuring the health and vitality of a democratic system. It provides a counterbalance to the ruling party, acts as a watchdog over their actions, gives voice to diverse perspectives, encourages political participation, and promotes democratic values. Without a strong opposition, a democratic system can become vulnerable to abuse of power, lack of accountability, and decline of democratic institutions.

Grace Brewster Murray Hopper (nee Murray; December 9, 1906 - January 1, 1992) was an American computer scientist and United States Navy rear admiral. One of the first programmers of the Harvard Mark I computer, she was a pioneer of computer programming who invented one of the first compiler related tools. She popularized the idea of machine-independent programming languages, which led to the development of COBOL, an early high-level programming language still in use today. Hopper had attempted to enlist in the Navy during World War II, but she was rejected by the military because she was 34 years of age and thus too old to enlist.

Following her retirement from the Navy, she was hired as a senior consultant to Digital Equipment Corporation (DEC). Hopper was initially offered the job position by Rita Yavinsky, but she insisted on applying for the position at DEC, and going through the typical formal interview process. She also sent a letter to Yavinsky's boss explaining that she would be available on alternating Thursdays, receiving a high salary, and have access to an unlimited expense account if she were to be exhibited at their museum of computing as a pioneer. After the proposal from Hopper, she was hired as a full-time senior consultant. As part of her position, she would report to Yavinsky. In this position, Hopper represented the company at industry forums, serving on various industry committees, along with other obligations. She retained that position until her death at age 85 in 1992.  Hopper was a goodwill ambassador in her primary activity in this capacity. She lectured widely about the early days of computing, her career, and on efforts that computer vendors could take to make life easier for their users. She visited most of Digital's engineering facilities, where she generally received a standing ovation at the conclusion of her remarks.  She often recounted that during her service she was frequently asked by admirals and generals why satellite communication would take so long. So during many of her lectures, she illustrated a nanosecond using salvaged obsolete Bell System 25 pair telephone cable, cut it to 11.8  inch (30  cm) lengths, the distance that light travels in one nanosecond, and handed out the individual wires to her listeners. Although no longer a serving officer, she always wore her Navy full dress uniform to these lectures, which is allowed by US Navy uniform regulations. Regardless of the chosen storage solution, remember the importance of proper maintenance. Cleaning these units regularly will not only prolong their lifespan but also create a more pleasant shower experience.

chosen:
The watermelon will roll B: slower on the dirty floor.

The speed at which an object like a watermelon rolls on a floor depends on several factors such as the type and condition of the floor, the roughness or smoothness of the surface, and the existence of any object or debris in the path of the rolling object. 

Starting with a waxed floor, it is characteristically smooth. The application of wax furnishes a polished surface that reduces the friction - which is the resistance one surface or object encounters when moving over another. A low-coefficient of friction would make it easier for the watermelon to roll. The smoother and harder the surface, the less energy is wasted in friction, and therefore, the higher the coefficient of rolling - meaning the watermelon can retain more of its kinetic energy and roll farther and faster.

On the other hand, a dirty floor usually has a rough and uneven surface. It may also consist of smaller particles like dust or sand, or larger ones like pebbles or bigger debris. All these factors contribute to an increased amount of friction between the watermelon and the floor. 

This increased friction means that more force is needed to maintain the watermelon's movement, and this force has to counteract not only the frictional force but also the irregularities of the floor. These irregularities can cause the watermelon to bump or bounce along, which wastes kinetic energy (the energy of motion) as vibrations and slows the watermelon down. 

Additionally, debris on the dirty floor can act as a barricade that further slows down the rolling watermelon or even stops it completely, depending on the size and structure of the debris met.

Therefore, owing to these varying circumstances, it is logical to conclude that the watermelon would roll slower on a dirty floor than it would on a waxed one.

To answer your question, animals that live with tiny zooxanthellae that also photosynthesize are called corals. Corals are tiny animals that live in colonies and have a symbiotic relationship with the zooxanthellae, which are single-celled algae that live inside the coral's tissues. The zooxanthellae photosynthesize and produce energy-rich compounds that the coral can use for growth and survival. In return, the coral provides the zooxanthellae with a safe place to live and access to the nutrients they need to survive.

Here's a step-by-step explanation of how this process works:

1. The coral polyp, which is the individual animal that makes up the coral colony, has a layer of tissue called the epidermis that is specialized for photosynthesis.
2. Inside the epidermis, the coral has a network of tiny membranes called endosymbionts, which are the site of photosynthesis.
3. The endosymbionts contain the zooxanthellae, which are single-celled algae that are capable of photosynthesis.
4. The zooxanthellae use sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen, just like plants do.
5. The glucose produced by the zooxanthellae is used by the coral as a source of energy for growth and survival.
6. The coral also provides the zooxanthellae with nutrients, such as nitrogen and phosphorus, which they need to survive.
7. In return for these nutrients, the zooxanthellae produce energy-rich compounds that the coral can use for growth and survival.

So, to summarize, corals are animals that live with tiny zooxanthellae that also photosynthesize, and this symbiotic relationship is essential for the survival of both the coral and the zooxanthellae.

prompt:
I watched this film last night with anticipation, but really wasn't very impressed.

With the exception of 'Combo', I thought the acting was poor and the narrative was limited. It came across like a 'made for TV' drama.

I felt that the film was very contrived. The whole set up of hammering in the context at the start (yes, we get that this is 80s Britain - you can stop now) was tiresome, and gave a very one-sided view of what life was like in 80s Britain - poverty, war juxtaposed with royalty, Margaret Thatcher, yet nothing in between? There were actually middle-classes who existed back then - just ordinary working people, with a decent wage and a mortgage. The Falklands clips also seemed to be added randomly towards the end, for 'dramatic effect', I presume.

The sequence of events felt a tad disjointed, as the characters moved one one action to the next without us seeing how their mindset could've changed so quickly.

The relationship between 'Shaun' and 'Smell' was toe-curling. I couldn't even look during the snogging scene. I find it very hard to believe that she would've been attracted to a boy who was not only so much younger, but also looked so much younger. I know there were only four years between them, but four years is nothing once you reach your twenties, yet it's a huge difference in your teens! In my experience, that kind of teen age difference only occurs when the girl is the younger one, since girls mature so much quicker, and are more on the wavelength of boys a few years older. Sorry, but I didn't buy it - an unnecessary plot point created for shock value.

The ending was somewhat abrupt and, again, contrived. If the flag throwing incident was supposed to be iconic, then it fell somewhat short in my eyes.

It bugs me that British films only concern themselves with either the upper classes or the poverty-stricken. Don't get me wrong, I love Trainspotting, and Four Weddings has its charms, but can't we Brits come up with anything different? Why are our films always so hung up on the class system? I was born in 1973, so wasn't much different in age to 'Shaun' would've been in 1983. I grew up in a single parent family on a fairly down-trodden council estate in a city in England. However, my childhood experiences were vastly different to those portrayed in the film - I don't even remember racism being an issue (although i'm not saying it didn't exist). 'This is England'? Not in my experience.

The bottom line is that I felt this film lacked substance, and I was completely bored and unimpressed throughout.

Is the sentiment of this review positive or negative?

Arachnids are a class of joint-legged invertebrate animals, known as Arthropods, which also include other well-known groups such as insects and crustaceans. Some of the most common arachnids include spiders, scorpions, ticks, and mites.

Arachnids are characterized by having two main body parts: the cephalothorax (front part) and the abdomen (back part). In total, arachnids have four pairs of legs, which equals to eight legs in total. These legs are attached to their cephalothorax. However, apart from these four pairs of legs, arachnids also possess additional pairs of appendages, which are designed to serve different functions.

The two additional pairs of appendages in arachnids are the pedipalps and the chelicerae:

1. Pedipalps: The pedipalps are the first pair of appendages and are located near the head of the arachnid. They function as sensory organs and can also be used to manipulate food or, in some cases, as an additional pair of legs. In male spiders, the pedipalps are modified to transfer sperm to the female during reproduction.

2. Chelicerae: The chelicerae are the second pair of appendages and are usually in the form of pincers or fangs. They are primarily used for feeding purposes. In spiders, the chelicerae contain venom glands, which deliver venom to their prey through their fangs.

Given these characteristics of arachnids, we can conclude that they have two additional pairs of appendages, apart from their four pairs of legs. In this case, the correct answer is:

A: 2

This preposterous potboiler would have made a perfect second feature for WRITTEN ON THE WIND, also from 1956. Douglas Sirk's saga of a powerful (and powerfully dysfunctional) oil clan was said to have inspired the 1980s night-time TV serial DALLAS but the Craig's low-brow excursion into insanity seems right out of it's sinful sister-soap, DYNASTY. All three siblings (only one of whom is really bad) are great beauties but it's Kathleen Hughes' cartoon villainy that stands out. Valerie is relentless in her quest to inherit the family fortune and her unbridled enthusiasm for evil is one of the movie's many guilty pleasures. Teenage sister Vicki is quite a piece of work as well, reminiscent of Carmen Sternwood in THE BIG SLEEP. When they first meet, she pulls the equivalent of trying to sit on Norton's lap while he's still standing by coming on to him with the line "I graduated summa cum laude from Embrace-able U." Whew!

THREE BAD SISTERS, produced by schlockmeister Howard W. Koch, is a terrific trash-wallow in exploitation excess and the cast is B-Movie Heaven: Marla "She Creature" English, 50s hunk John "Revenge Of The Creature" Bromfield (once married to French sexpot Corinne Calvet), Universal starlet Sara Shane (discovered by Hedy Lamarr), Jess "Mr. Susan Hayward" Barker, Kathleen "It Came From Outer Space" Hughes, and former silent screen star Madge Kennedy give it all they've got -however much or little that is. Future Eurotrash star Brett Halsey (TRUMPET OF THE Apocalypse) is seen briefly as one of Vicki's victims.

B-Movie rating: 10/10 Marla (and her body English) made marvelous movies! THREE BAD SISTERS was recently seen on the big screen as part of the Palm Springs Film Noir Festival but the jury's still wiping soap suds out of ...aw hell, it's noir (5/10 on the noirometer).

Did this review think positively or negatively of the movie?

"Pojď do auta!" is an imperative sentence in Czech, which is used to command someone to get into a car. The word "pojď" is a command form of the verb "pojet" which means "to get" or "to go", and "do auta" means "into the car". So, the phrase as a whole can be translated to English as "Get in the car!"

On the other hand, "Nech si ten tón!" is a phrase that is used to request someone to take a specific tone or attitude. The word "nech" is a negative form of the verb "chovat" which means "to have" or "to hold", and "si" is a reflexive pronoun that indicates that the action is being done to oneself. The word "tón" means "tone" or "attitude". So, the phrase as a whole can be translated to English as "Take a tone!" or "Adopt a specific attitude!".

In the context of a conversation, someone might say "Pojď do auta!" to a friend or family member who is taking a long time to get ready to go somewhere, while "Nech si ten tón!" might be used to ask someone to be more serious or professional in their demeanor, especially in a work or formal setting.

Club play of house tracks by pioneering Chicago DJs such as Hardy and Lil Louis, local dance music record shops such as Importes Etc., State Street Records, Loop Records, Gramaphone Records and the popular Hot Mix 5 shows on radio station WBMX-FM helped popularize house music in Chicago. Later, visiting DJs and producers from Detroit fell into the genre. Trax Records and DJ International Records, Chicago labels with wider distribution, helped popularize house music inside and outside of Chicago. One 1986 house tune called "Move Your Body" by Marshall Jefferson, taken from the appropriately titled "The House Music Anthem" EP, became a big hit in Chicago and eventually worldwide. By 1986, UK labels were releasing house music by Chicago acts, and by 1987 house tracks by Chicago DJs and producers were appearing on and topping the UK music chart. Playboy's Pics Are Coming to iPad, Despite Apple's Anti-Porn Rules
Don't just read the articles -- Playboy's eye-popping pics are coming to the iPad.

This March, the entire Playboy catalog will be made available for the iPad in all its uncensored glory -- photo spreads, centerfolds and all -- magazine founder Hugh Hefner confirmed on Twitter.

"Big news! Playboy -- both old & new -- will be available on iPad beginning in March," Hefner tweeted on his official feed. "The iPad version of Playboy will include the whole magazine from the first issue to the latest.”

Hefner made explicit what users of the app would see: “Playboy on iPad will be uncensored,” he said. The men's magazine will be produced by digital magazine publisher Bondi Digital, which admitted that it was powering the eye-popping iPad app.

"I can confirm that we are in development with them," Bondi co-founder David Anthony told FoxNews.com. "You'll be able to access [Playboy] via the browser in your tablet and use the same password to access it on your computer" -- where you'll be able see far, far more than just the stories.

The announcement comes out of left field, given Apple’s notorious censorship policy. The company has a range of restrictions on apps to eliminate content it deems explicit, such as pornography, gambling, drugs and even file-sharing. Apple claims the right to reject any app that it feels is in violation of its terms of services.

Some have speculated that Apple was rethinking this policy, in the wake of the announcement by CEO Steve Jobs that he was taking time off to focus on his health. When contacted by FoxNews.com, Apple declined to comment.

Playboy spokesman Theresa Hennessey clarified Hefner's statement, telling FoxNews.com that the comely centerfolds and sensual snaps from the magazine won't be available in an iPad app after all.

"We are releasing a web-based subscription service with Bondi Digital Publishing that will give users access to every issue of Playboy both past and present. The service will be iPad-compatible and will utilize iPad functions," Hennessey said.

But never fear, loyal readers! Hennessey revealed that Playboy's engineers “also have plans to release a non-nude version of a Playboy-branded iPad app in the coming months that adheres to all of Apple’s policies and guidelines.”

Hefner’s somewhat misleading statements highlight a loophole in Apple’s closed ecosystem: the fine line that separates the iPad experience through an app from the experience of a website tailor-made for tablets -- which Apple has limited editorial control over.

Those seeking Playboy's titillating photos will access Bondi's custom website, not the app, which will -- of course -- be censored. The closed system is unfortunate, Anthony said, preventing an entire class of VERY visual magazines from reaching consumer eyeballs on the glossy digital screen.

"The thing that I think is so fascinating about tablets is that the user experience is very natural for turning pages and zooming in on them," he told FoxNews.com. Apple's editorial control over apps "prevents certain kinds of magazines from going through that outlet," he noted.

That's where Bondi comes in. Anthony hopes that with his company’s technology, the power to choose now once again lies in the hands of the consumer.

“The idea from our perspective was to get in as much of that functionality as humanly possible, via the web app we’re creating,” Anthony said. The underlying technology is already being used to archive the Playboy catalog online as well as other print magazines such as Rolling Stone.

Bondi is currently working on switching from the Microsoft Silverlight platform to HTML 5 to ensure that the site will work smoothly on the iPad come the March launch.

"I think that consumers will ultimately decide what content they want," he said. "We feel it's our job to make it as accessible as possible for Playboy readers.”

Given the paragraph above, please answer correctly the following question:   Which student learned less about ants that manage large herds of aphids ?  Hint: Some species of ants farm aphids, protecting them on the plants where they are feeding, and consuming the honeydew the aphids release from the terminations of their alimentary canals. This is a mutualistic relationship, with these dairying ants milking the aphids by stroking them with their antennae. Although mutualistic, the feeding behaviour of aphids is altered by ant attendance. Aphids attended by ants tend to increase the production of honeydew in smaller drops with a greater concentration of amino acids.Some farming ant species gather and store the aphid eggs in their nests over the winter. In the spring, the ants carry the newly hatched aphids back to the plants. Some species of dairying ants (such as the European yellow meadow ant, Lasius flavus) manage large herds of aphids that feed on roots of plants in the ant colony. Queens leaving to start a new colony take an aphid egg to found a new herd of underground aphids in the new colony. These farming ants protect the aphids by fighting off aphid predators.

South Dakota executes man for rape, death of 9-year-old girl in 1990
A South Dakota inmate was executed Tuesday night for the 1990 rape and murder of a 9-year-old girl who disappeared after leaving her home to buy sugar at a nearby store so she could make lemonade.

Donald Moeller, 60, received a lethal injection at the state penitentiary in Sioux Falls, marking South Dakota's second execution this month in an unusual surge for a state that has carried out just two other death sentences since 1913. He was pronounced dead at 10:24 p.m.

Moeller kidnapped Becky O'Connell from a Sioux Falls convenience store, where she'd gone to buy sugar to make lemonade at home. He drove her to a secluded area near the Big Sioux River, then raped and stabbed the girl. Her naked body was found the next day; investigators said her throat had been slashed.

Becky's mother, Tina Curl, has been steadfast in her wish to watch Moeller die, even raising funds to cover the expenses to make the 1,400-mile trip from her home in New York state to Sioux Falls for the execution.

"He watched my daughter take her last breath. I want to watch him take his last breath," Curl told The Associated Press in August. "I'm doing this for her and for me."

Moeller initially was convicted in 1992, but the state Supreme Court overturned it, ruling that improper evidence was used at trial. He was again convicted and sentenced to die in 1997. The state Supreme Court affirmed the sentence, and Moeller lost appeals on both the state and federal levels.

Though he fought his conviction and sentence for years, Moeller in July he said he was ready to accept death as the consequence of his actions. He admitted for the first time in court that he killed the girl.

"I killed. I deserve to be killed," he said.

But even as Moeller insisted he was ready to die, several motions were filed on his behalf to stop the execution despite his protests.

Earlier this month, a federal judge dismissed a pending suit challenging South Dakota's execution protocol after Moeller insisted he wanted no part of it. Moeller also distanced himself from a motion filed by a woman with loose family ties who argued that his decades in solitary confinement had made him incapable of voluntarily accepting his fate. That motion was dismissed Monday.

Moeller's execution comes just two weeks after the Oct. 15 execution of Eric Robert for killing South Dakota prison guard Ronald "R.J." Johnson during a failed escape attempt.

Before that, the last execution in South Dakota was in 2007, when Elijah Page died by lethal injection for the murder of Chester Allan Poage, who was abducted and killed in a scheme to burglarize his mother's home.

In 1947, George Sitts was electrocuted for killing two law enforcement officers. And in 1913, Joseph Rickman was hanged for the murder of a woman and her daughter.

They were among 17 inmates executed since 1877, the oldest of which came during the days of the Dakota Territory

Kanoldt was born in Karlsruhe . His father was the painter Edmond Kanoldt , a late practitioner of the Nazarene style . After studies at the Academy of Fine Arts Karlsruhe in Karlsruhe he went to Munich in 1908 , where he met a number of modernists such as Alexei Jawlensky , Wassily Kandinsky and Gabriele Münter . He became a member of the Munich New Secession in 1913 , with Jawlensky and Paul Klee . After military service in World War I from 1914 to 1918 , the still lifes Kanoldt painted show the influence of Derain and an adaptation of cubist ideas . By the early 1920s Kanoldt developed the manner for which he is best known , a magic realist rendering of potted plants , angular tins , fruit and mugs on tabletops . He also painted portraits in the same severe style , as well as geometrical landscapes . In 1925 he was made a professor at Breslau Academy , a post he held until 1931 . During this time he came into conflict with the Bauhaus faction at the Academy , and he was increasingly at odds with the avant garde . From 1933 until his resignation in 1936 he was the director of the State School of Art in Berlin . With the rise of the Nazi regime in 1933 Kanoldt attempted accommodation , painting in a romantic style , but nonetheless many of his works were seized by the authorities as degenerate art in 1937 . "Where I come from you don't get to sing a song if you have nothing to say," says the musician, who grew up in Highfield, a ghetto neighborhood in the Zimbabwean capital of Harare. chosen:
The answer is the Ferris Wheel. George Washington Gale Ferris, Jr., an American civil engineer, invented the Ferris Wheel for the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition held in Chicago, Illinois. The exposition commemorated the 400th anniversary of Christopher Columbus' arrival in the New World in 1492, and America wanted to showcase something that would rival the Eiffel Tower, which had been the centerpiece of the 1889 Paris Exposition.

Ferris was inspired by the idea of creating a unique and impressive attraction that could captivate people's imagination and demonstrate America's engineering prowess. He decided to design a gigantic observation wheel that not only would symbolize the technological advancement of the country but also generate the same level of excitement and awe that the Eiffel Tower had created during the Paris Exposition.

Ferris' wheel, named the "Ferris Wheel," stood 264 feet tall and had a capacity to carry more than 2,000 passengers at once. The wheel featured 36 fully enclosed passenger gondolas, each with an approximate seating capacity of 60 people. The observation wheel allowed passengers to experience panoramic views of the exposition and the surrounding areas from a height and perspective never before seen.

Despite facing skepticism and doubts from fellow engineers and critics about the safety and feasibility of such a colossal structure, Ferris successfully demonstrated his engineering marvel to the world. The Ferris Wheel became the star attraction of the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition and an enduring symbol of human ingenuity and innovation.

Since then, the Ferris Wheel has become a staple among amusement parks and various global events across the world. It has evolved in terms of technology, size, and design, with newer and larger versions being constructed as a testament to mankind's fascination with these rotating wonders. Notable examples include the London Eye in the United Kingdom and the Singapore Flyer in Singapore.

In summary, George Washington Gale Ferris, Jr. invented the Ferris Wheel as an engineering marvel for the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago, in hopes of showcasing an attraction as impressive as the Eiffel Tower. The Ferris Wheel has since become a beloved and enduring symbol of entertainment and engineering achievement across the globe.

First, gather all the necessary materials and tools. This includes dry leaves, tinder, small twigs, larger sticks, logs, matches or a lighter, and a firestarter if available. It is crucial to have a blend of different sizes of wood to maintain the fire once it starts.

Step 1: Find a suitable location. Look for a flat, clear area away from any overhanging branches or flammable materials. An existing fire pit or a circle of rocks can be a good spot for containing the fire.

Step 2: Prepare the fire pit. If there isn't an existing fire pit, create a small depression in the ground and surround it with rocks. This will help contain the fire and provide a barrier from wind.

Step 3: Arrange the materials. Start by placing a small pile of dry leaves or tinder in the center of the fire pit. These materials catch fire easily and will act as the base for the campfire.

Step 4: Build a structure. Place the small twigs in a teepee shape over the tinder. Make sure to leave an opening for the air and to light the fire. Then, place the larger sticks around the small twigs, also in a teepee shape. Finally, stack the logs around the sticks, ensuring that they have good contact with the other materials to help the fire spread.

Step 5: Light the fire. Using matches or a lighter, ignite the tinder in the center of the structure. The flames will spread from the tinder to the twigs, then the sticks, and eventually the logs. Blow gently on the fire if it needs more oxygen to grow.

Step 6: Maintain the fire. Add more wood when necessary, and reposition logs if they're not burning evenly. Remember to exercise caution when handling the fire. Always keep a safe distance and have a source of water nearby in case of emergencies.

In summary, the next steps in starting a campfire are finding a suitable location, preparing the fire pit, arranging the materials, building a structure, lighting the fire, and maintaining it safely.

The Kashmir issue is a complex and long-standing territorial dispute between India, Pakistan, and to some extent, China. Over the years, several possible solutions have been proposed to resolve the conflict. However, a resolution remains elusive due to various factors, including opposing political, cultural, and historical perspectives. Some possible solutions to the Kashmir issue include:

1. Plebiscite: This is based on the United Nations Security Council Resolution 47 passed in 1948, which calls for a plebiscite in the region to determine the will of the Kashmiris. 2. Bilateral talks: India and Pakistan could engage in direct dialogue and negotiations, without any preconditions, to find a mutually acceptable solution. This would require both countries to put aside historical mistrust and focus on the primary concerns of the people living in the region.

3. Tripartite talks: Including the Kashmiri people as the third party in talks between India and Pakistan could result in better understanding and representation of the aspirations of the Kashmiris. This approach is based on the understanding that ultimately, any long-lasting solution must be acceptable to the people of Kashmir.

4. Border adjustments: Some proposals suggest redefining the border between India and Pakistan in order to transfer certain areas to the country that is better able to address the particular region's challenges. This could potentially minimize tensions and provide a basis for long-term peace.

5. Regional autonomy: Both India and Pakistan could explore providing greater autonomy to their respective parts of Kashmir, allowing the people in the region to exercise more control over local governance and development. This could create a more inclusive and stable environment and could address some of the underlying grievances.

6. Economic and social cooperation: Encouraging cross-border trade, tourism, and cultural exchanges could promote peace and understanding between the two countries and their respective Kashmir regions. By fostering economic ties and promoting common interests, the focus could shift towards shared development, rather than confrontation.

7. International mediation: A neutral third party could facilitate negotiations between India and Pakistan. This option would require both countries to agree on the mediator and accept the recommendations that come out of the mediation process.

Ultimately, any solution to the Kashmir issue should adhere to the principles of justice, peace, and the welfare of the people living in the region. It is essential for India, Pakistan, and the Kashmiri people to commit to a dialogue process that addresses their concerns, aspirations, and grievances. Only through genuine engagement and a willingness to compromise can a lasting peace be achieved in this disputed region.

prompt:
Write a title for this article:

Consolidated Edison yesterday released a preliminary report on the blackout that left 100,000 people in western Queens in muggy darkness last month. The report provided the most extensive chronology so far of the multiple failures, in primary feeders and secondary lines, that contributed to the blackouts severity and duration.

Kevin M. Burke, Con Edisons chairman, president and chief executive, met with Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg for an hour at City Hall yesterday morning to discuss the report and to brief the mayor on the utilitys handling of the current heat wave.

The report did not examine the causes of the blackout. A fuller report analyzing the roots of the power failure will take a couple of months to complete, Mr. Burke said.

Mr. Bloomberg, whose measured response and refusal to attack Con Edison drew criticism from some Queens politicians and residents, struck a slightly sharper note when he discussed the preliminary report yesterday. Am I satisfied? he asked. Of course not. Its the beginning of a process, and we are going to find out what happened and what steps we can take to make sure it does not happen in the future.

Mayor Bloomberg also said the city had hired an Albany law firm, Couch White, and assembled a team of outside experts to assist the city as the states Public Service Commission begins an investigation into the blackout, which lasted from July 17 to 25.

The report Con Ed released yesterday focuses on the Long Island City network, one of 57 underground networks that supply 86 percent of the electricity used in Con Edisons service area, which covers New York City and most of Westchester County. The Long Island City network serves 115,000 customers  including private homes as well as residential and commercial buildings  in Astoria, Sunnyside, Woodside, Hunters Point and Long Island City, along with Rikers Island and La Guardia Airport.

The report revealed that 14 of the 22 feeder cables failed at some point between 3:50 p.m. on July 17 and 8:01 a.m. on July 21, when the last feeder cable was re-energized. However, the feeder cable damage caused such extensive damage to the secondary grid that the blackout did not end until the night of July 25.

Title: Obama Streaker to be Paid 'Extremely Handsomely'

Introduction:

In what can only be described as an unorthodox act of protest, an unnamed individual's decision to streak past former President Barack Obama during a recent public event has garnered him substantial monetary rewards. Labeled as the "Obama Streaker," this individual has managed to capture the attention of not just the President himself, but also artists, entrepreneurs, and other public figures who have been inspired by his bravado.

A Controversial Act of Expression

The incident took place on September 19, 2023, during a speech that Obama was delivering at a climate change summit held in Chicago. The former President was speaking about the importance of sustainable energy practices when an unidentified man rushed past him, completely nude, with the words "CLIMATE CHANGE NOW" written across his chest. The streaker's unexpected presence initially shocked the audience, leaving some in attendance amused, some infuriated, and many simply perplexed. 

As security personnel apprehended the streaker, Obama maintained his composure and even cracked a joke, saying, "Well, it seems that the climate change movement is gaining some ‘exposure’," much to the amusement of the attendees. Nonetheless, the man's daring act sent ripples across social media platforms, sparking discussions and debates on the effectiveness of such protest methods.

An Unexpected Payoff

While one might think that the individual would face criminal charges or simply slide into internet obscurity, his fortunes have taken quite a dramatic turn. Within days, the "Obama Streaker" became a viral sensation, earning support as well as disapproval on social media platforms. As it turns out, some individuals were so inspired by his bold move that they have opted to reward him monetarily. 

Among the most notable supporters was an avant-garde artist known as Demetrius Krawczyk, who proclaimed the streaker's act as "a powerful statement" and a "symbolic cry for change." Krawczyk reportedly offered to collaborate with the streaker on a future art project and promised to pay him a substantial sum for his participation.

In another surprising twist, a prominent tech entrepreneur, Jack Doctrow, extended a lucrative offer that would see the streaker become the face of his company's newest climate change mitigation project. The two parties have yet to finalize a deal, but one thing is clear: the streaker is poised to receive a handsome payout should they choose to proceed.

The Debate Over Streaking as a Protest

The "Obama Streaker" has, without a doubt, generated awareness for climate change, albeit in a less-than-conventional manner. In this digital age, it could be argued that unorthodox methods of protest can yield just as much, if not more, attention than traditional protest events. Social media has played a significant role in increasing the streaker's visibility, turning him into a potent symbol for the climate change movement.

However, others argue that his act of streaking is not only disrespectful, but it also detracts from the actual message and causes people to focus on the act itself rather than the underlying issue. For these critics, the incident raises important questions about the efficacy of such provocative protest methods, and whether or not they can lead to tangible change.

Conclusion:

The "Obama Streaker" has undoubtedly sparked conversation regarding climate change and opened up discussions on the merits of unconventional protest methods. However, the effectiveness of such tactics remains subject to debate. But one thing’s for sure, as this individual stands to be paid 'extremely handsomely' for his daring move, the lines between protest, art, and commercialism continue to blur.

Thirdly, in response to the weather conditions, airline and airport staff may implement additional safety and security measures, such as inspections of planes and airport facilities. These processes can take time and can further increase the waiting time for passengers.

In conclusion, adverse weather conditions can significantly affect the waiting time for passengers at various stages of the travel process, often leading to increased wait times in line. Therefore, the answer to the question is A: more.

If people stopped buying diet pills, there would be a wide range of consequences for the economy, the pharmaceutical industry, the way society perceives weight loss and dieting, and individual health. The impact would differ in various areas, which I will explore in detail below.

1. Economic impact: The diet pill industry is a multi-billion dollar market. A significant decrease in demand for these products would lead to an economic downturn for manufacturers, distributors, and retailers involved in the diet pill business. This could result in job losses and reduced revenues for companies specializing in weight loss supplements. Additionally, the advertising and marketing industries that support diet pill promotion would also see a decline in business.

2. Pharmaceutical industry: If the demand for diet pills declines, the pharmaceutical companies specializing in weight loss products would face financial challenges as well. They may decide to shift their focus and resources to the development of other medications and treatments that are still in demand. This could potentially lead to breakthroughs in unrelated areas of medical research as companies attempt to diversify their product offerings.

3. Societal perception of weight loss and dieting: As people become more skeptical of diet pills, there might be a shift in societal thinking on the topic of weight loss. Greater emphasis could be placed on healthier and more sustainable approaches to losing weight, such as balanced diets and regular exercise. This change in mentality could lead to increased public investment in preventative health measures and long-term wellness programs, ultimately improving overall public health.

4. Individual health: With less reliance on diet pills, individuals seeking weight loss would be more likely to adopt healthier lifestyle changes. This shift could lead to a lower prevalence of obesity and its related health issues, such as heart disease, diabetes, and high blood pressure. Moreover, discontinuing the use of diet pills could also reduce the risk of adverse side effects and drug interactions associated with these products.

5. Alternative weight loss methods: In the absence of diet pills, people might explore other options for weight loss, including alternative therapies and treatments. There could be a surge in demand for services such as nutrition coaching, personal training, weight loss support groups, and wellness retreats. This would create new markets and opportunities for businesses and professionals in these fields.

6. Regulation and government intervention: A decline in demand for diet pills could lead to increased government scrutiny into the safety and efficacy of weight loss supplements. Regulators might impose stricter guidelines and regulations on the industry, leading to the development of higher quality products that are clinically proven to be safe and effective. This would benefit both consumers and the overall integrity of the weight loss supplement market.

In summary, if people stopped buying diet pills, the resulting consequences would impact the economy, the pharmaceutical industry, societal perceptions of weight loss, individual health, the demand for alternative weight loss methods, and potential government regulation of the industry. While some of these consequences would be negative, such as economic downturns and job losses, others could lead to positive outcomes, including a healthier population and a renewed focus on sustainable weight loss methods.

chosen:
Making drinks cold quickly can be achieved through several methods, each with varying levels of efficiency. Here is a step-by-step guide to some of the most effective techniques:

1. Ice and Salt Water Bath (Fastest method):
   a. Fill a large bowl, bucket, or cooler with ice cubes or crushed ice.
   b. Add cold water to the container, making sure it covers about half of the ice.
   c. Mix in a generous amount of salt (preferably rock or kosher salt) to the ice-water mixture. The salt reduces the freezing point of water, allowing the solution to become colder than regular ice water.
   d. Submerge your drink in the saltwater bath, ensuring that it is fully surrounded by the ice.
   e. Gently stir your drink in the ice bath or swirl the ice around it to maximize contact with the cold mixture.
   f. Leave the drink in the ice bath for at least 3-5 minutes for cans or small bottles, and 7-10 minutes for larger bottles, checking frequently until the desired temperature is reached.

2. Wet Paper Towel Method:
   a. Dampen a sheet of paper towel with cold water, ensuring that it is saturated but not dripping.
   b. Wrap the wet paper towel around your drink, entirely covering its surface.
   c. Place the wrapped drink in the freezer for 10-15 minutes, depending on the size of the container and the desired temperature. Check regularly to prevent freezing.
   d. Remove your drink from the freezer once it has reached the appropriate coldness.

3. Spin and Chill (with caution):
   a. Place your drink in the freezer and set a timer for 1-2 minutes. This will help bring down its temperature slightly.
   b. Remove your drink from the freezer and partially submerge it in an ice bucket or bowl filled with ice.
   c. Carefully spin your drink along its horizontal axis for 30-60 seconds. The spinning motion helps to cool down the drink more evenly and quickly by convection.
   d. Be cautious with carbonated drinks, as spinning them may cause pressure buildup. In this case, you can try gently rotating the containers in the ice.
   e. Check the temperature of your drink and repeat the spinning process if necessary until it reaches the desired coldness.

4. Using a Blast Chiller or Instant Beverage Chiller (Requires specialized equipment):
   a. Obtain a blast chiller or instant beverage chiller, which are designed to cool drinks quickly.
   b. Place your drink in the designated area of the appliance according to the manufacturer's instructions.
   c. Set the timer as specified by the device's user manual (usually 2-10 minutes, depending on the appliance and drink size).
   d. Wait for the appliance to cool your drink to the desired temperature.

Regardless of the method you choose, always remember that regular monitoring and gentle handling are crucial to ensure the desired results and avoid over-freezing or pressurization. Happy chilling!

Ah, the age-old problem of how to make drinks cold quickly! As an AI assistant, I've got just the tips and tricks you need to achieve this goal.

First and foremost, it's important to understand that there are a few key factors that determine how quickly your drinks will chill: the type of drink, the starting temperature, and the cooling method. So, let's dive into each of these factors and explore some strategies for making your drinks cold quickly.

1. Choose the right drink: Some drinks are naturally more cold-sensitive than others. For example, water and other clear liquids will chill more quickly than creamy or milky drinks, as the fat content in the latter can slow down the cooling process. Additionally, drinks with a higher alcohol content will generally chill more quickly than those with a lower alcohol content, as alcohol has a lower freezing point than water.
2. Start with the right temperature: The starting temperature of your drink can have a big impact on how quickly it chills. If your drink is already close to the desired temperature, it will take less time to reach the finish line. For example, if you're starting with a room-temperature drink, it will take longer to chill than if you were starting with a drink that's already slightly chilled.
3. Choose the right cooling method: There are several methods you can use to cool your drinks quickly, each with its own strengths and weaknesses. Here are a few popular options:

a. Refrigeration: This is perhaps the most straightforward method of cooling drinks quickly. Simply place your drink in the refrigerator and let the magic of modern technology do its thing. The key here is to make sure your refrigerator is set to the correct temperature (around 40°F or 4°C) and that your drink is not overcrowding the fridge, as this can slow down the cooling process.

b. Ice: Adding ice to your drink is a classic cooling method that works surprisingly well. The key here is to use the right type of ice. For example, crushed ice or ice cubes will chill your drink more quickly than regular ice, as they have a larger surface area that's in contact with the drink. Additionally, using a combination of ice and a cooling method like refrigeration can be especially effective.

c. Ice water: Another effective cooling method is to use ice water. This involves adding a handful of ice to a pitcher of water, then stirring the mixture and pouring it over your drink. This method is particularly effective for chilling drinks quickly, as the ice water will lower the temperature of your drink more quickly than just adding ice alone.

d. Blenders: If you're looking for a more high-tech solution, consider using a blender to chill your drinks. Blenders like the Vitamix or Blendtec can chill drinks to a temperature of around 40°F (4°C) in just a few minutes. This method is particularly effective for chilling large quantities of drinks quickly.

e. Dry ice: Finally, if you're looking for a truly dramatic effect, consider using dry ice to chill your drinks. Dry ice is frozen carbon dioxide that sublimates (turns directly into a gas) at room temperature, which makes it an extremely effective cooling agent. Simply add a few pieces of dry ice to your drink and watch as it chills almost instantly. Just be sure to handle dry ice with care, as it can be dangerous if not handled properly.
4. Use the right equipment: Finally, the equipment you use to chill your drinks can also have an impact on how quickly they chill. For example, using a glass or plastic cup with a narrow mouth can help to keep your drink cold, as the narrow opening will slow down the flow of heat into the cup. Similarly, using a straw can help to keep your drink cold, as the straw will help to keep the drink away from your mouth and tongue, which are the warmest parts of your body.

In conclusion, making drinks cold quickly is a matter of understanding the factors that affect cooling and choosing the right cooling method for your needs. By considering the type of drink, the starting temperature, and the cooling method you use, you can chill your drinks quickly and effectively. Happy chilling!

It said that attacks on its soil by the Somalia-based al-Shabab group had been planned in the camp.
"The camp had lost its humanitarian nature and had become a haven for terrorism and other illegal activities," Kenyan government spokesman Eric Kiraithe said.
"The lives of Kenyans matter. Our interest in this case, and in the closure of Dadaab refugee camp, remains to protect the lives of Kenyans," he added.
Dadaab was set up in 1991 to house families fleeing conflict in Somalia, and some people have been living there for more than 20 years.
The Kenya National Commission on Human Rights and lobby group Kituo Cha Sheria challenged the decision in court, saying it was discriminatory and contrary to international law.
"The government's decision specifically targeting Somali refugees is an act of group persecution, illegal discriminatory and therefore unconstitutional," Judge John Mativo said.
The orders are excessive, arbitrary and disproportionate, he said.
The BBC's Nancy Kacungira in the capital, Nairobi, says the ruling means the government has to start putting in place mechanisms that will restore regular operations at the camp even though it will launch an appeal.
Kenya's refugee department had already been shut, which meant that new-born babies were not being registered as refugees, Said Abuka, a community leader and refugee in Nairobi, told the Associated Press news agency.
Amnesty International welcomed the ruling, saying it affirmed Kenya's legal obligation to protect people who seek safety from harm and persecution.
"Today is a historic day for more than a quarter of a million refugees who were at risk of being forcefully returned to Somalia, where they would have been at serious risk of human rights abuses," the rights group's Muthoni Wanyeki said in a statement.
Mr Kiraithe said since the closure of Dadaab was announced, more than 51,000 Somalis had voluntarily returned to Somalia.
"We are encouraged that Somalia continues to stabilise politically more so with the election of a new president," he added.
Somalia's 'Mr Cheese' president has a lot on his plate
Somalia's UN-backed government, with the help of a 22,000-strong African Union force, is battling Islamist group al-Shabab to regain control of the country.
But it has only managed to secure major towns.
The militants, who impose a strict version of Islam in the areas they control, still mount deadly bombings and have carried out a string of attacks in neighbouring Kenya.
Kenya is currently building a fence along its 700km (435-mile) border with Somalia, but has completed only 4km so far.

It was released to quench the thirst of fans of the trilogy while they wait for the unspecified release of The Book of Dust , and also to expand upon Pullman 's themes from the trilogy . A fold - out map of `` Oxford by Train , River and Zeppelin '' is bound in the book , a fictional map of the Oxford that exists in Lyra 's world . It also includes some advertisements for books and travellers ' catalogues . Two pages from a Baedeker published in Lyra 's world ( including entries for the Eagle Ironworks , the Oxford Canal , the Fell Press and the Oratory of St Barnabas the Chymist , all in the Jericho area of Oxford ) , a postcard from the character Mary Malone , and a brochure for the cruise ship Zenobia are also included . Pullman compares the movement of these objects to particles in a cloud chamber . The idea is that they have floated accidentally through an inter-world window . The postcard contains four images of significant sites in the His Dark Materials trilogy : the physics lab in which Mary Malone works , the house occupied by Lord Boreal , the row of hornbeam trees where Will first discovered a window between the worlds , and the bench where Lyra and Will have pledged to visit each other at least in spirit once a year . In 2008, "The Times" named Pullman one of the "50 greatest British writers since 1945". Christians believe him to be the Son of God and the awaited Messiah (Christ) prophesied in the Old Testament. Virtually all modern scholars of antiquity agree that Jesus existed historically, although the quest for the historical Jesus has produced little agreement on the historical reliability of the Gospels and on how closely the biblical Jesus reflects the historical Jesus. Jesus was a Galilean Jew who was baptized by John the Baptist and subsequently began his own ministry, preaching his message orally and often being referred to as "rabbi". He was arrested and tried by the Jewish authorities, and was crucified by the order of Pontius Pilate, the Roman prefect. The novel continues the adventures of Lyra Belacqua as she investigates the mysterious Dust phenomenon and searches for her father. Will Parry is introduced as a companion to Lyra, and together they explore the new realms to which they have both been introduced.  - The Book of Dust is a forthcoming novel by Philip Pullman. prompt:
Write a title for this article:

Some Tea Party activists are complaining that their grassroots movement has been co-opted by the corporate mainstream Republican Party. Progressives are complaining that their hope-and-change president has been co-opted by pro-corporate, Democratic centrism.

Books could be written about the myriad ideological divides between the Tea Party and Progressives, but I’m struck at this moment by our similarities. Perhaps it’s time for these populist insurgencies to unite in the short-term to topple the political status quo that hampers each of our long-term agendas. Regardless of which party comes out on top after the mid-term elections, it will neither be as progressive nor as Tea Party-infused as either side would like -- and in terms of restoring politics to the people, both sides will still have more work to do. So what could a joint Progressive Tea Party agenda look like? 1. Ensure Clean Elections. At the very least, we all want to remove the veil of anonymity and know who’s really behind campaign donations on the left and right. But beyond that, both the Tea Party and Progressives are concerned that Washington politicians increasingly represent their moneyed campaign donors (whether big business or unions) more than their voting constituents.

We can’t return politics to the people if politics is a wholly-owned subsidiary of corporate America.

Imagine if both sides of the political aisle demanded that candidates only take public funding for campaigns. And ultimately we could overturn Supreme Court rulings on money and politics and mandate strict campaign finance restrictions. 2. End Bailouts and Subsidies for Big Business. The Tea Party began with opposition to the TARP bailout of big banks. For years, Progressives have opposed government subsidies of corporate agriculture and tax abatements for big businesses that alleged aim to create new jobs but end up just increasing profits. If we believe in the private market, then for-profit businesses should compete on their own without government assistance. 3. Abolish Corporate Personhood. The Tea Party wants to decrease the role of government. Progressives want to decrease the influence of giant corporations in our government and our society in general. One way to do both is to get rid of laws and practices that treat corporations as people. Otherwise, not only do behemoth corporations wield disproportionate power in America, but government resources are expended catering to and protecting the “rights” of big business.

Tea Party adherents are big critics of the notion of “rights” in general. At least we can agree to abolish person-like rights for big business -- to make government more responsive to actual human beings. Once enacted, these three actions would dramatically curtail the corrupting influence of special interests in government and society and return power to the people. Then we can return to our respective ideological corners to fight over tax cuts versus public infrastructure or the future of gays and guns -- but at least we’d be fighting fair, with the outcomes truly determined by public will as opposed to which side's outsized corporate influence throws its weight behind which argument. I think substantively there’s even more we might agree on, like abolishing unfair “free” trade agreements like NAFTA that have hurt workers in the U.S. and abroad, or creating real incentives for locally-owned businesses and small scale enterprise.

Given the escalated vitriol between Tea Party members and Progressives, it can be hard to recognize that, in fact, most of us share common concerns and common dreams. And amidst all the extreme rhetoric, it can be hard to acknowledge that our shared problems have shared solutions. Reforming the political process itself is a good place to start. Both the Tea Party and Progressives are fed up. For too long, the agenda in Washington has been dictated by K Street. It’s time to return politics to Main Street. Then, whatever the ideological outcome, at least it we’d have a political system about which, whether left or right, we could all be proud.

Sally Kohn is the Founder and Chief Education Officer of the Movement Vision Lab (http://movementvision.org), a grassroots popular education organization.

0 + 755 = -151d - 755 + 755

755 = -151d

755 / -151 = -151d / -151

-5 = d

2. Apply the formula: We will substitute the side length (2 cm) into the formula:

   Area = (2² * √3) / 4

   Area = (4 * √3) / 4

   Area = √3

This can be achieved through the exchange of knowledge and the study of comparative law, which can help to consolidate the idea of a shared judicial culture across Europe.

The legal community in Europe is diverse and includes judges, lawyers, legal scholars, and other professionals who are involved in the administration of justice. By bringing together these individuals and institutions, the European judicial culture can be fostered and developed. This can involve the sharing of best practices, the discussion of legal issues and challenges, and the collaboration on legal research and education.

One of the key benefits of involving the legal community in the development of a European judicial culture is the ability to learn from one another. Different legal systems and jurisdictions have developed unique approaches to resolving legal issues, and by studying these approaches, the legal community can gain a deeper understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of different legal systems. This can help to identify best practices and to develop more effective and efficient legal systems.

Another benefit of involving the legal community in the development of a European judicial culture is the ability to promote consistency and coherence in the application of the law. By studying and applying comparative law, judges and lawyers can ensure that the law is applied consistently and in a manner that is consistent with the principles of justice and fairness. This can help to promote public trust in the legal system and to ensure that the law is applied in a manner that is fair and just for all individuals and organizations.

Furthermore, the involvement of the legal community in the development of a European judicial culture can help to promote the rule of law. By fostering a culture of respect for the law and for the legal system, the legal community can help to ensure that the law is upheld and that the rights of individuals are protected. This can help to promote stability and security in society, and to ensure that the law is applied in a manner that is fair and just for all individuals and organizations.

In conclusion, the legal community in Europe should be involved in the development of a European judicial culture, as their contribution can consolidate the idea of a true European judicial culture, through the exchange of knowledge and the study of comparative law. By fostering a culture of respect for the law and for the legal system, the legal community can help to promote the rule of law, consistency and coherence in the application of the law, and the development of more effective and efficient legal systems.

Title: Last Call at Midnight

Liz, a prestigious investigative journalist renowned for her integrity and tenacity, lives a seemingly ordinary life by day, but by night she dives into the darker corners of society to uncover the truth.

Plot:

One night, Liz, burdened by a recent unsolved murder case in her city that has paralyzed the community with fear, decides to stop off at a strip club. On the surface, it's an odd place for Liz to fetch a drink, but she has a theory. Liz believes in exploring the unbeaten paths and going beyond conventional wisdom to find the naked truth. This includes the strip club, a place overlooked as the breeding ground for sinister plots due to its surface portrayal. She connects the dots between an increase in crime and this club run by a powerful and shady individual, known as Scar.

Upon receiving an anonymous tip from a source, citing Scar's possible involvement with the unsolved murder, Liz decides to take the risk. The strip club becomes her temporary solace, a place she visits under the facade of a regular patron enjoying a drink, all while keeping her true intention hidden.

Her first encounters at the club are uneventful. However, Liz's persistent visits and sharp observation reveal unusual patterns. She notices that girls employed at the club often disappear for a short duration mid-shift and return looking fearful and distressed. More unsettling is the fact that no one seems to question this strange behavior.

Simultaneously, Liz forms an unexpected alliance with Ruby, a stripper at the club who's also nursing dreams of escaping the club's gritty reality. Ruby, too, feels that something is amiss at the club and yearns for a way out. 

One night, while Liz is sat at the bar, nursing her drink, Ruby drops a key and a note saying, "The truth is in the basement." Trusting her instincts and Ruby, Liz ventures into the dimly-lit basement after hours. There she discovers a clandestine underground business of drug trafficking and illegal weapons trade, led by Scar. In a horrifying realization, she also uncovers that the murder victim had worked at the strip club and had been ousted when she threatened to expose this secret.

With this newfound evidence, Liz is now in a race against time to expose Scar and his gruesome business whilst making sure that both she and Ruby gets out alive. Besieged by danger at every turn, Liz uses her cunning and resilience to gather the evidence she needs and relies on her allies to unmask the insidious operations in front of the public and authorities, leading to Scar's arrest.

As the curtain falls, Liz is once again seated at the strip club, a reminder of the journey she took. Not just to uncover a story, but the discovery of her courage and will to act against all odds. Liberated now from the clutches of Scar, the strip club is no longer a den of crime, but just another quiet place where people like Liz can stop for a drink. 

Last Call at Midnight, an engrossing thriller, is a tale of fear and redemption, courage and truth, all revolving around Liz's pursuit of justice ignited by a simple question, "What does Liz stop off at the strip club for?" A drink turned out to be more than just a drink; it was the key to unraveling the chilling truth that linked the strip club to a web of dark secrets and crime. A testament that sometimes, the pursuit of truth leads to unexpected places.

prompt:
In architecture Durer cites Vitruvius but elaborates his own classical designs and columns. In typography, Durer depicts the geometric construction of the Latin alphabet, relying on Italian precedent. However, his construction of the Gothic alphabet is based upon an entirely different modular system. The fourth book completes the progression of the first and second by moving to three-dimensional forms and the construction of polyhedra. Here Durer discusses the five Platonic solids, as well as seven Archimedean semi-regular solids, as well as several of his own invention. In all these, Durer shows the objects as nets. Finally, Durer discusses the Delian Problem and moves on to the 'construzione legittima', a method of depicting a cube in two dimensions through linear perspective. It was in Bologna that Durer was taught (possibly by Luca Pacioli or Bramante) the principles of linear perspective, and evidently became familiar with the 'costruzione legittima' in a written description of these principles found only, at this time, in the unpublished treatise of Piero della Francesca. He was also familiar with the 'abbreviated construction' as described by Alberti and the geometrical construction of shadows, a technique of Leonardo da Vinci. Although Durer made no innovations in these areas, he is notable as the first Northern European to treat matters of visual representation in a scientific way, and with understanding of Euclidean principles. In addition to these geometrical constructions, Durer discusses in this last book of Underweysung der Messung an assortment of mechanisms for drawing in perspective from models and provides woodcut illustrations of these methods that are often reproduced in discussions of perspective. 

Question: "Which of the alphabets does Durer depict in his architecture?"

Response: "Archimedean"
